meanings.definition: The quality of being capable of causing cellular damage or disease.
meanings.sent1: The cytopathogenicity of the virus led to severe cell damage.

meanings.sent3: The cytopathogenicity of the rogue cells in the body was like a tiny army causing chaos.

meanings.sent5: The vivid red color of the infected cells highlighted the cytopathogenicity of the disease.

meanings.definition: The ability of a virus or other microorganism to induce pathological changes in cells.
meanings.sent1: Researchers investigated the cytopathogenicity of the new virus strain.
meanings.sent2: The cytopathogenicity of the pathogen was evident in the altered cell structure.
meanings.sent3: The cytopathogenicity of the virus was like a puzzle, changing the cells in unexpected ways.
